verses.kjv: The righteous perisheth, and no man layeth it to heart: and merciful men are taken away, none considering that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come.
verses.web: The righteous perish, and no one lays it to heart. Merciful men are taken away, and no one considers that the righteous is taken away from the evil.
verses.ct: Good people die and no one cares. The faithful are taken from this life, and nobody stops to realize that they are being spared from the disaster ahead.

verses.kjv: He shall enter into peace: they shall rest in their beds, each one walking in his uprightness.
verses.web: He enters into peace. They rest in their beds, each one who walks in his uprightness.
verses.ct: Those who live uprightly find peace in death. They rest on their beds, at ease at last.

verses.kjv: But draw near hither, ye sons of the sorceress, the seed of the adulterer and the whore.
verses.web: “But draw near here, you sons of a sorceress, you offspring of adulterers and prostitutes.
verses.ct: "But you — come here, you children of a sorceress, you offspring of adulterers and prostitutes!

verses.kjv: Against whom do ye sport yourselves? against whom make ye a wide mouth, and draw out the tongue? are ye not children of transgression, a seed of falsehood,
verses.web: Whom do you mock? Against whom do you make a wide mouth and stick out your tongue? Aren’t you children of disobedience and offspring of falsehood,
verses.ct: Who are you mocking? Who are you making faces at, sticking out your tongues? You are nothing but children of sin, offspring raised on lies!

verses.kjv: Enflaming yourselves with idols under every green tree, slaying the children in the valleys under the clifts of the rocks?
verses.web: you who inflame yourselves among the oaks, under every green tree; who kill the children in the valleys, under the clefts of the rocks?
verses.ct: You burn with lust for your idols under every green tree. You slaughter your own children in the valleys, beneath the overhanging cliffs.

verses.kjv: Among the smooth stones of the stream is thy portion; they, they are thy lot: even to them hast thou poured a drink offering, thou hast offered a meat offering. Should I receive comfort in these?
verses.web: Among the smooth stones of the valley is your portion. They, they are your lot. You have even poured a drink offering to them. You have offered an offering. Shall I be appeased for these things?
verses.ct: The smooth stones in the streambeds — those are your gods, those are what you've chosen! You pour out drink offerings to them and bring them grain offerings. Should I just accept all this?

verses.kjv: Upon a lofty and high mountain hast thou set thy bed: even thither wentest thou up to offer sacrifice.
verses.web: On a high and lofty mountain you have set your bed. You also went up there to offer sacrifice.
verses.ct: You set up your bed on every high and towering mountain, climbing up there to offer sacrifices.

verses.kjv: Behind the doors also and the posts hast thou set up thy remembrance: for thou hast discovered thyself to another than me, and art gone up; thou hast enlarged thy bed, and made thee a covenant with them; thou lovedst their bed where thou sawest it.
verses.web: You have set up your memorial behind the doors and the posts, for you have exposed yourself to someone besides me, and have gone up. You have enlarged your bed and made you a covenant with them. You loved what you saw on their bed.
verses.ct: You placed your pagan symbols behind your doors and doorposts. You stripped yourself bare for others besides me, climbing into bed with them. You made deals with your lovers and craved what you saw there.

verses.kjv: And thou wentest to the king with ointment, and didst increase thy perfumes, and didst send thy messengers far off, and didst debase thyself even unto hell.
verses.web: You went to the king with oil, increased your perfumes, sent your ambassadors far off, and degraded yourself even to Sheol.
verses.ct: You went to the king drenched in oil and loaded with perfume. You sent your ambassadors to distant lands, degrading yourself all the way down to Sheol.

verses.kjv: Thou art wearied in the greatness of thy way; yet saidst thou not, There is no hope: thou hast found the life of thine hand; therefore thou wast not grieved.
verses.web: You were wearied with the length of your ways; yet you didn’t say, ‘It is in vain.’ You found a reviving of your strength; therefore you weren’t faint.
verses.ct: You wore yourself out chasing after all these things, yet you never said, 'This is hopeless.' You kept finding just enough strength to keep going, so you never gave up.

verses.kjv: And of whom hast thou been afraid or feared, that thou hast lied, and hast not remembered me, nor laid it to thy heart? have not I held my peace even of old, and thou fearest me not?
verses.web: “Whom have you dreaded and feared, so that you lie, and have not remembered me, nor laid it to your heart? Haven’t I held my peace for a long time, and you don’t fear me?
verses.ct: "Who were you so afraid of that you chose to lie? You forgot all about me — never gave me a second thought. I stayed silent for a long time, and because of that you don't fear me at all.

verses.kjv: I will declare thy righteousness, and thy works; for they shall not profit thee.
verses.web: I will declare your righteousness; and as for your works, they will not benefit you.
verses.ct: I will expose your so-called righteousness and everything you've done — and none of it will help you.

verses.kjv: When thou criest, let thy companies deliver thee; but the wind shall carry them all away; vanity shall take them: but he that putteth his trust in me shall possess the land, and shall inherit my holy mountain;
verses.web: When you cry, let those whom you have gathered deliver you; but the wind will take them. a breath will carry them all away: but he who takes refuge in me will possess the land, and will inherit my holy mountain.”
verses.ct: When you cry out for help, let that collection of idols rescue you! But the wind will sweep them all away — a single breath will carry them off. The one who takes refuge in me, however, will possess the land and inherit my holy mountain."

verses.kjv: And shall say, Cast ye up, cast ye up, prepare the way, take up the stumblingblock out of the way of my people.
verses.web: He will say, “Build up, build up, prepare the way! Remove the stumbling-block out of the way of my people.”
verses.ct: And he will say, "Build it up! Build up the road! Clear the path! Remove every obstacle from the way of my people."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the high and lofty One that inhabiteth eternity, whose name is Holy; I dwell in the high and holy place, with him also that is of a contrite and humble spirit, to revive the spirit of the humble, and to revive the heart of the contrite ones.
verses.web: For the high and lofty One who inhabits eternity, whose name is Holy, says: “I dwell in the high and holy place, with him also who is of a contrite and humble spirit, to revive the spirit of the humble, and to revive the heart of the contrite.
verses.ct: For this is what the high and exalted One says — the One who lives forever, whose name is Holy: "I live in the high and holy place, but I also live with the one whose spirit is crushed and humble. I am there to revive the spirit of the humble and to breathe life back into the heart of the broken."

verses.kjv: For I will not contend for ever, neither will I be always wroth: for the spirit should fail before me, and the souls which I have made.
verses.web: For I will not contend forever, neither will I always be angry; for the spirit would faint before me, and the souls whom I have made.
verses.ct: "I will not fight against you forever, and I won't stay angry without end — because if I did, the spirit would waste away before me, the very souls I created.

verses.kjv: For the iniquity of his covetousness was I wroth, and smote him: I hid me, and was wroth, and he went on frowardly in the way of his heart.
verses.web: I was angry because of the iniquity of his covetousness and struck him. I hid myself and was angry; and he went on backsliding in the way of his heart.
verses.ct: I was angry because of his greedy sin, so I struck him. I hid my face in anger, but he kept stubbornly going his own way.

verses.kjv: I have seen his ways, and will heal him: I will lead him also, and restore comforts unto him and to his mourners.
verses.web: I have seen his ways, and will heal him. I will lead him also, and restore comforts to him and to his mourners.
verses.ct: I have watched how he lives, and yet I will heal him. I will guide him and bring comfort back to him and to those who mourn for him.

verses.kjv: I create the fruit of the lips; Peace, peace to him that is far off, and to him that is near, saith the LORD; and I will heal him.
verses.web: I create the fruit of the lips: Peace, peace, to him who is far off and to him who is near,” says LORD; “and I will heal them.”
verses.ct: I will put praise on their lips: Peace, peace to those who are far away and to those who are near," says the LORD. "I will heal them."

verses.kjv: But the wicked are like the troubled sea, when it cannot rest, whose waters cast up mire and dirt.
verses.web: But the wicked are like the troubled sea; for it can’t rest and its waters cast up mire and mud.
verses.ct: But the wicked are like a restless sea that never calms down — its waves constantly churning up mud and filth.

verses.kjv: There is no peace, saith my God, to the wicked.
verses.web: “There is no peace”, says my God, “for the wicked.”
verses.ct: "There is no peace," says my God, "for the wicked."
